result.execSummary:
The defendant Danielle E Delvoye was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA, out of prison funds with 2019CF3350 at a rate to be determined by DOC, balance paid during extended supervision. Any bail on deposit to apply. Failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence; credit of 74 days time served

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Danielle E Delvoye

defendant.name: Delvoye, Danielle E
defendant.address: W149N8206 Winchester Drive, Menomonee Falls, WI 53051

records.addlTxt: notice of completion by attorney Schwarz

Defendant Danielle E Delvoye in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Danielle E Delvoye in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

As to Count 2: Pursuant to negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders charge dismissed, but read-in for sentencing purposes.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. 
As to Count 1: Defendant ordered to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence, credit of 74 days time served. 
Pay mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA, out of prison funds with 2019CF3350 at a rate to be determined by DOC, balance paid during extended supervision. Any bail on deposit to apply. Failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights
Defendant's Jury instructions received and filed.
Pre-trial conference on June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Danielle E Delvoye in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Danielle E Delvoye in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Danielle E Delvoye appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Defense request to be heard on bail at pretrial conference.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
